page.title: 03Language
page.content: Here are a few dialect words from our area, unfortunately the people who use them become fewer-is it caused by the BBC? "Don't peyle"-don't be flustered "G'im be-est"-given back "sark"-shirt "Sheppy "-starling "brids"-birds "By't rack o'th'ee"-guessed measures "cruds"-curds "wer"-our "snek"-nose "neether,nawther"-neither "bas"-basket "baggin"-snack or food taken to work "okard"-awkward "cob"-unusual "aye"-yes "axing"-asking, "britches" -trousers "frittened"-frightened "rum"-strange, "praiters"-potatoes "witchet"-wet feet, "summat"-something "weel"-well "deg"-water "slutch"-mud "snig"-eel "est'a bod"-where are you going "est'a bin"-where have you been "sin o bod"-can you see "owt"-anything "nowt"-nothing "fettle"-mend "fain"-glad,"scriking"-crying,"Preesaw "-Preesall.
